intro: Mosannona vasquezii, commonly known as the Vásquez's mosannona, is a species of flowering plant in the family Anacardiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
